result.execSummary:
The defendant Rachel H. Mendoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant has 63 days credit if probation revoked.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or education or a combination thereof

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent. Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety from alcohol & controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rachel H. Mendoza in court with attorney Brent W Varner.  Defendant Rachel H. Mendoza in custody.  John A Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State states agreement.  Atty Varner agrees and NC pleas entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty Varner makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised of felony firearm warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.  Atty Varner requests 60 day stay on jail commencement as DE needs time to make arrangments for her child as she has been unable to raise the cash bail to previously be released on this matter.  State objects.  Court denies request for stay and orders jail sentence commence forthwith.

Ct 1 and Ct 2:  NC
Probation for 5 years on each count concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
Costs of $268.00 x 2 to be paid during term of probation
One DNA surcharge of $250.00 to be paid per agent and DNA sample to be provided
Count 1 only - 1 year jail w/huber/childcare as a condition of probation to commence FORTHWITH
AODA/Treatment per agent
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances w/o a valid prescription
No taverns/liquor stores or stores selling drug paraphernalia
Obtain/maintain full-time employment or education or a combination thereof
63 days sentence credit only if probation is revoked

Cts 3, 4 and 5:  Dismissed/read-in
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on August 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Atty Varner acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continued.

Defendant Rachel H. Mendoza in court with attorney Brent W Varner.  Defendant Rachel H. Mendoza in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes DE will waive prelim and proceed to arraignment today.  Atty Varner agrees.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.

Pre-trial conference on April 4, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Return date on April 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Rachel H. Mendoza in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  Defendant Rachel H. Mendoza in custody.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances and status.  Atty Varner states DE will waive time limits today and requests PTC and RD be set.  DE agrees.  Court accepts time limit waiver and bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 11:15 am.  Return date scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Rachel H. Mendoza by video from LEC with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Defendant Rachel H. Mendoza in custody.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Steinman responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived.  $3,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  No contact w/co-actor C.F.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
